texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: A

texts.orig: BILL

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ENTITLED

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: A BILL to  establish  the  Emerging  Technologies  Agency  to  advance  and  facilitate  the adoption of emerging technologies; to promote research, innovation and development  of  emerging  technology  tools;  to  deploy  emerging  technology  to increase social and economic productivity; to provide a harmonised a body of rules on emerging technology obligations, rights, ethics and safety, and for related matters.
texts.text: A BILL to  establish  the  Emerging  Technologies  Agency  to  advance  and  facilitate  the adoption of emerging technologies; to promote research, innovation and development  of  emerging  technology  tools;  to  deploy  emerging  technology  to increase social and economic productivity; to provide a harmonised a body of rules on emerging technology obligations, rights, ethics and safety, and for related matters.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Emerging Technologies Agency
texts.text: Emerging Technologies Agency

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Establishment of the Emerging Technologies Agency
texts.text: Establishment of the Emerging Technologies Agency

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. (1)   There  is  established  by  this  Act  the  Emerging  Technologies  Agency  as  a  body corporate.
texts.text: (1)   There  is  established  by  this  Act  the  Emerging  Technologies  Agency  as  a  body corporate.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2)   For  the  performance  of  functions,  the  Agency  may  acquire  and  hold  property, dispose of property and enter into a contract or any other related transaction.
texts.text: (2)   For  the  performance  of  functions,  the  Agency  may  acquire  and  hold  property, dispose of property and enter into a contract or any other related transaction.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3)   Where there is a hindrance to the acquisition of land, the land may be acquired for the Agency under the Land Act, 2020 (Act 1036) and the cost shall be borne by the Agency.
texts.text: (3)   Where there is a hindrance to the acquisition of land, the land may be acquired for the Agency under the Land Act, 2020 (Act 1036) and the cost shall be borne by the Agency.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Object of the Agency
texts.text: Object of the Agency

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. The objects of the Agency are to:
texts.text: The objects of the Agency are to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) advance and facilitate the adoption of emerging technology in the country;
texts.text: (a) advance and facilitate the adoption of emerging technology in the country;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) promote research, innovation and development of emerging technology tools in the country;
texts.text: (b) promote research, innovation and development of emerging technology tools in the country;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) deploy emerging technology to increase social and economic productivity;
texts.text: (c) deploy emerging technology to increase social and economic productivity;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) provide a harmonised a body of rules on rights related to risks ethics and safety;
texts.text: (d) provide a harmonised a body of rules on rights related to risks ethics and safety;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) create awareness of emerging technology;
texts.text: (e) create awareness of emerging technology;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) promote cross-border transfer of emerging-technology-based goods and services for the international development, marketing and use of  systems;
texts.text: (e) promote cross-border transfer of emerging-technology-based goods and services for the international development, marketing and use of  systems;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) ensure  that  activities  related  to  emerging  technology  and  emerging  technology systems are consistent with human rights, democracy and the rule of law.
texts.text: (f) ensure  that  activities  related  to  emerging  technology  and  emerging  technology systems are consistent with human rights, democracy and the rule of law.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Functions of the Agency
texts.text: Functions of the Agency

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. To achieve the objects under section 2, the Agency shall:
texts.text: To achieve the objects under section 2, the Agency shall:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) advise the Government and public institutions on all matters related to emerging technology in the country;
texts.text: (a) advise the Government and public institutions on all matters related to emerging technology in the country;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) optimise emerging technology for economic development of the country;
texts.text: (b) optimise emerging technology for economic development of the country;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) ensure  efficiency  within  the  emerging  technology  value  chain  by  promoting research, creativity and innovation;
texts.text: (c) ensure  efficiency  within  the  emerging  technology  value  chain  by  promoting research, creativity and innovation;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) promote  an  emerging  technology  curriculum,  an  emerging  technology-based curriculum  and  emerging  technology  education,  particularly  through  inclusive educational  programmes,  to  expand  emerging  technology  knowledge  and  to increase the number of graduates, academics, practitioners and professionals with expertise  in  emerging  technology  and  related  disciplines  in  data  science,  data engineering, computer science, among others;
texts.text: (d) promote  an  emerging  technology  curriculum,  an  emerging  technology-based curriculum  and  emerging  technology  education,  particularly  through  inclusive educational  programmes,  to  expand  emerging  technology  knowledge  and  to increase the number of graduates, academics, practitioners and professionals with expertise  in  emerging  technology  and  related  disciplines  in  data  science,  data engineering, computer science, among others;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) equip  people,  especially  underserved  and  unserved  communities,  with  skills  in emerging technology to promote technological agency and awareness;
texts.text: (e) equip  people,  especially  underserved  and  unserved  communities,  with  skills  in emerging technology to promote technological agency and awareness;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) empower the  youth  with  skills  and  tools  to  broaden  their  participation  in  the emerging technology value chain for, job creation opportunities, involvement in the digital economy, and the digital development of the economy;
texts.text: (f) empower the  youth  with  skills  and  tools  to  broaden  their  participation  in  the emerging technology value chain for, job creation opportunities, involvement in the digital economy, and the digital development of the economy;

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) develop  digital  infrastructure  to  build  robust  emerging  technology  systems  for affordable access for all persons;
texts.text: (g) develop  digital  infrastructure  to  build  robust  emerging  technology  systems  for affordable access for all persons;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) promote the adoption of emerging technology in the public sector and for public services;
texts.text: (h) promote the adoption of emerging technology in the public sector and for public services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) to create a conducive and investment-ready environment for private organisations, start-ups and innovative companies in the emerging technology industry;
texts.text: (i) to create a conducive and investment-ready environment for private organisations, start-ups and innovative companies in the emerging technology industry;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (j) encourage competitiveness in the development of emerging technology tools and systems;
texts.text: (j) encourage competitiveness in the development of emerging technology tools and systems;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (k) facilitate data access, data availability and data governance across institutions for the  advancement  of  emerging  technology,  while  safeguarding  citizens'  privacy, security and rights in accordance with the Data Protection Act;
texts.text: (k) facilitate data access, data availability and data governance across institutions for the  advancement  of  emerging  technology,  while  safeguarding  citizens'  privacy, security and rights in accordance with the Data Protection Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (l) build  and  coordinate  an  emerging  technology  community  for  the  sharing  of knowledge, creating synergies, and development of emerging technology;
texts.text: (l) build  and  coordinate  an  emerging  technology  community  for  the  sharing  of knowledge, creating synergies, and development of emerging technology;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (m) accelerate the adoption of emerging technology in key sectors of the economy including healthcare, agriculture, transportation, energy, lands and natural resources and financial services;
texts.text: (m) accelerate the adoption of emerging technology in key sectors of the economy including healthcare, agriculture, transportation, energy, lands and natural resources and financial services;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (n) encourage  investments  in  the  emerging  technology  eco-system  to  provide  for sustainable development of emerging technology;
texts.text: (n) encourage  investments  in  the  emerging  technology  eco-system  to  provide  for sustainable development of emerging technology;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (o) deploy  strategies  to  implement  research  findings  towards  the  promotion  of emerging technology;
texts.text: (o) deploy  strategies  to  implement  research  findings  towards  the  promotion  of emerging technology;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (p) establish guidelines, standards and codes of practice for risk-protected, healthy, safe, ethical and practical use of emerging technology;
texts.text: (p) establish guidelines, standards and codes of practice for risk-protected, healthy, safe, ethical and practical use of emerging technology;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (q) address product safety, privacy and consumer protection challenges and opportunities presented by emerging technology;
texts.text: (q) address product safety, privacy and consumer protection challenges and opportunities presented by emerging technology;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (r) provide technical support for emerging technology developers;
texts.text: (r) provide technical support for emerging technology developers;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (s) promote international cooperation with respect to emerging technology; and
texts.text: (s) promote international cooperation with respect to emerging technology; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (t) perform any other functions which are ancillary to the objects of the Agency.
texts.text: (t) perform any other functions which are ancillary to the objects of the Agency.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Powers of the Agency
texts.text: Powers of the Agency

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 4. (1) The Agency shall determine the nature, process and undertakings necessary for the effective performance of its functions under this Act.
texts.text: 4. (1) The Agency shall determine the nature, process and undertakings necessary for the effective performance of its functions under this Act.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) The Agency is granted the power to:
texts.text: The Agency is granted the power to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) issue regulations, rules, directives and guidelines under this Act;
texts.text: (a) issue regulations, rules, directives and guidelines under this Act;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) facilitate conciliation, mediation and negotiation on disputes arising from this Act; and
texts.text: (b) facilitate conciliation, mediation and negotiation on disputes arising from this Act; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) make any determination as the Agency finds just and equitable.
texts.text: (c) make any determination as the Agency finds just and equitable.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Governance of the Governing body of the Agency
texts.text: Governance of the Governing body of the Agency

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. The governing body of the Agency is a Board consisting of
texts.text: The governing body of the Agency is a Board consisting of

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) a chairperson;
texts.text: (a) a chairperson;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) one representative from the following;
texts.text: (b) one representative from the following;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) The Ministry not below the rank of a Chief Director;
texts.text: (i) The Ministry not below the rank of a Chief Director;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) Data Protection Commission not below the rank of Deputy Director-General;
texts.text: (ii) Data Protection Commission not below the rank of Deputy Director-General;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iii) National  Information  Technology  Agency  not  below  the  rank  of  Deputy Director-General;
texts.text: (iii) National  Information  Technology  Agency  not  below  the  rank  of  Deputy Director-General;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) one representative nominated by the Industry Forum;
texts.text: (c) one representative nominated by the Industry Forum;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) one representative from the Accra Digital Centre;
texts.text: (d) one representative from the Accra Digital Centre;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) two other persons nominated by the President on the advice of the Minister, at least one of whom is a woman; and
texts.text: (e) two other persons nominated by the President on the advice of the Minister, at least one of whom is a woman; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) Chief Executive Officer of the Agency.
texts.text: (f) Chief Executive Officer of the Agency.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Functions of the Board
texts.text: Functions of the Board

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. The Board shall, subject to the provisions of this Act,
texts.text: The Board shall, subject to the provisions of this Act,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) have oversight responsibility for the Agency;
texts.text: (a) have oversight responsibility for the Agency;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) be responsible for the strategic direction and policies of the Agency; and
texts.text: (b) be responsible for the strategic direction and policies of the Agency; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) ensure the efficient and effective performance of the functions of the Agency.
texts.text: (c) ensure the efficient and effective performance of the functions of the Agency.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Tenure of office of members
texts.text: Tenure of office of members

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 7. (1)  A member of the Board shall hold office for a period not exceeding three years and is  eligible  for  re-appointment but a member shall not be appointed for more than two terms.
texts.text: 7. (1)  A member of the Board shall hold office for a period not exceeding three years and is  eligible  for  re-appointment but a member shall not be appointed for more than two terms.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Subsection (1) does not apply to the Chief Executive Officer of the Agency.
texts.text: Subsection (1) does not apply to the Chief Executive Officer of the Agency.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3) A member of the Board may at any time resign from office in writing addressed to the President through the Minister.
texts.text: (3) A member of the Board may at any time resign from office in writing addressed to the President through the Minister.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (4) A member of the Board, other than the Chief Executive Officer who is absent from three consecutive meetings of the Board without sufficient cause ceases to be a member of the Board.
texts.text: (4) A member of the Board, other than the Chief Executive Officer who is absent from three consecutive meetings of the Board without sufficient cause ceases to be a member of the Board.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (5) The President may by letter addressed to a member revoke the appointment of that member.
texts.text: (5) The President may by letter addressed to a member revoke the appointment of that member.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (6) Where a member of the Board is, for a sufficient reason, unable to act as a member, the Minister shall determine whether the inability would result in the declaration of a vacancy.
texts.text: (6) Where a member of the Board is, for a sufficient reason, unable to act as a member, the Minister shall determine whether the inability would result in the declaration of a vacancy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7) Where there is a vacancy
texts.text: Where there is a vacancy

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) under subsection (3) or (4);
texts.text: (a) under subsection (3) or (4);

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) as a result of a declaration under subsection (6); or
texts.text: (b) as a result of a declaration under subsection (6); or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) by reason of the death of a member the Minister shall notify the President of the vacancy and the President shall appoint a person to fill the vacancy.
texts.text: (c) by reason of the death of a member the Minister shall notify the President of the vacancy and the President shall appoint a person to fill the vacancy.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Meetings of the Board
texts.text: Meetings of the Board

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 8. (1)  The Board shall meet at least once every three months for the dispatch of business at the times and in the places determined by the chairperson.
texts.text: 8. (1)  The Board shall meet at least once every three months for the dispatch of business at the times and in the places determined by the chairperson.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) The chairperson shall at the request in writing of not less than one-third of the membership of the Board convene an extraordinary meeting of the Board at the place and time determined by the chairperson.
texts.text: (2) The chairperson shall at the request in writing of not less than one-third of the membership of the Board convene an extraordinary meeting of the Board at the place and time determined by the chairperson.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3)  The quorum at a meeting of the Board is seven members of the Board or a greater number determined by the Board in respect of an important matter.
texts.text: (3)  The quorum at a meeting of the Board is seven members of the Board or a greater number determined by the Board in respect of an important matter.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (4)  The chairperson shall preside at meetings of the Board and in the absence of the chairperson, a member of the Board elected by the members present from among their number shall preside.
texts.text: (4)  The chairperson shall preside at meetings of the Board and in the absence of the chairperson, a member of the Board elected by the members present from among their number shall preside.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (5)  Matters before the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting and in the event of an equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a casting vote.
texts.text: (5)  Matters before the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present and voting and in the event of an equality of votes, the person presiding shall have a casting vote.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (6)  The Board may co-opt a person to attend a Board meeting but that person shall not vote on a matter for decision at the meeting.
texts.text: (6)  The Board may co-opt a person to attend a Board meeting but that person shall not vote on a matter for decision at the meeting.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Disclosure of interest
texts.text: Disclosure of interest

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. (1)    A member of the Board who has an interest in a matter for consideration
texts.text: (1)    A member of the Board who has an interest in a matter for consideration

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) shall disclose the nature of the interest and the disclosure shall form part of the record of the consideration of the matter; and
texts.text: (a) shall disclose the nature of the interest and the disclosure shall form part of the record of the consideration of the matter; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) shall not participate in the deliberations of the Board in respect of that matter.
texts.text: (b) shall not participate in the deliberations of the Board in respect of that matter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) A member ceases to be a member of the Board if that member has an interest on a matter before the Board and
texts.text: A member ceases to be a member of the Board if that member has an interest on a matter before the Board and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) fails to disclose that interest; or
texts.text: (a) fails to disclose that interest; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) participates in the deliberations of the Board in respect of the matter.
texts.text: (b) participates in the deliberations of the Board in respect of the matter.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Establishment of committees
texts.text: Establishment of committees

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 10. (1)   The Board may establish committees consisting of members of the Board or nonmembers or both to perform a function.
texts.text: 10. (1)   The Board may establish committees consisting of members of the Board or nonmembers or both to perform a function.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)   A committee of the Board may be chaired by a member of the Board.
texts.text: A committee of the Board may be chaired by a member of the Board.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3)   Section 8 applies to members of committees of the Board.
texts.text: Section 8 applies to members of committees of the Board.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Allowances
texts.text: Allowances

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 11. Members of the Board and members of a committee of the Board shall be paid the allowances  approved  by  the  Minister  in  consultation  with  the  Minister  responsible  for Finance.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Appointment of Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Appointment of Chief Executive Officer

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 14. (1)   The President shall, in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution, appoint a Chief Executive Officer for the Agency.
texts.text: 14. (1)   The President shall, in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution, appoint a Chief Executive Officer for the Agency.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2)   The Chief Executive Officer shall hold office on the terms and conditions specified in the letter of appointment.
texts.text: (2)   The Chief Executive Officer shall hold office on the terms and conditions specified in the letter of appointment.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3)  The Chief Executive Officer shall not be subject to suspension or dismissal by any Agency during his or her term.
texts.text: (3)  The Chief Executive Officer shall not be subject to suspension or dismissal by any Agency during his or her term.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (4)   The Chief Executive Officer shall be a person of high moral character and integrity with the relevant professional qualifications and experience related to the functions of the Agency.
texts.text: (4)   The Chief Executive Officer shall be a person of high moral character and integrity with the relevant professional qualifications and experience related to the functions of the Agency.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Functions of the Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Functions of the Chief Executive Officer

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 15. (1) The Chief Executive Officer is responsible for
texts.text: 15. (1) The Chief Executive Officer is responsible for

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) the day-to-day administration of the affairs of the Agency and is answerable to the Board in the performance of functions under this Act, and
texts.text: (a) the day-to-day administration of the affairs of the Agency and is answerable to the Board in the performance of functions under this Act, and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) the implementation of the decisions of the Board.
texts.text: (b) the implementation of the decisions of the Board.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) The Chief Executive Officer shall perform any other functions determined by the Board.
texts.text: (2) The Chief Executive Officer shall perform any other functions determined by the Board.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3) The Chief Executive Officer may delegate a function to an officer of the Agency but shall not be relieved of the ultimate responsibility for the performance of the delegated function.
texts.text: (3) The Chief Executive Officer may delegate a function to an officer of the Agency but shall not be relieved of the ultimate responsibility for the performance of the delegated function.

texts.orig: Appointment of Deputy Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Appointment of Deputy Chief Executive Officer

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 16. (1) The President shall, in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution appoint a Deputy Chief Executive Officer for the Agency.
texts.text: 16. (1) The President shall, in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution appoint a Deputy Chief Executive Officer for the Agency.

texts.orig: (2) The Deputy Chief Executive Officer shall hold office on such terms and conditions as shall be specified in his letter of appointment.
texts.text: (2) The Deputy Chief Executive Officer shall hold office on such terms and conditions as shall be specified in his letter of appointment.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3) The Deputy Chief Executive Officer shall be responsible to the Chief Executive Officer in the performance of his functions under this Act.
texts.text: (3) The Deputy Chief Executive Officer shall be responsible to the Chief Executive Officer in the performance of his functions under this Act.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (4) The Deputy Chief Executive Officer  shall, subject to the provisions of this Act
texts.text: (4) The Deputy Chief Executive Officer  shall, subject to the provisions of this Act

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) assist the Chief Executive Officer in the discharge of his functions and perform such other functions as the Director General may delegate to him; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) be  responsible  for  the  direction  of  the  Agency  when  the  Chief  Executive Officer is absent from Ghana or is otherwise unable to perform his functions.
texts.text: (b) be  responsible  for  the  direction  of  the  Agency  when  the  Chief  Executive Officer is absent from Ghana or is otherwise unable to perform his functions.

texts.orig: Appointment of other staff
texts.text: Appointment of other staff

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 17. (1) The President shall, in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution, appoint any other staff of the Agency that are necessary for the efficient and effective performance of the functions of the Agency.
texts.text: 17. (1) The President shall, in accordance with article 195 of the Constitution, appoint any other staff of the Agency that are necessary for the efficient and effective performance of the functions of the Agency.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) Other public officers may be transferred or seconded to the Agency or may give assistance to the Agency.
texts.text: (2) Other public officers may be transferred or seconded to the Agency or may give assistance to the Agency.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3)   The Agency may, for the efficient and effective discharge of the functions of the Agency, engage the services of consultants and advisors on the recommendation of the Board.
texts.text: (3)   The Agency may, for the efficient and effective discharge of the functions of the Agency, engage the services of consultants and advisors on the recommendation of the Board.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Accounts and audit
texts.text: Accounts and audit

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 19. (1) The Board shall keep books of accounts and proper records in relation to them in the form approved by the Auditor-General.
texts.text: 19. (1) The Board shall keep books of accounts and proper records in relation to them in the form approved by the Auditor-General.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) The Board shall submit the accounts of the Agency to the Auditor-General for audit within three months after the end of the financial year.
texts.text: (2) The Board shall submit the accounts of the Agency to the Auditor-General for audit within three months after the end of the financial year.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3)  The  Auditor-General  shall,  not  later  than  three  months  after  the  receipt  of  the accounts, audit the accounts and forward a copy of the audit report to the Minister.
texts.text: (3)  The  Auditor-General  shall,  not  later  than  three  months  after  the  receipt  of  the accounts, audit the accounts and forward a copy of the audit report to the Minister.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Annual report and other reports
texts.text: Annual report and other reports

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 20. (1) The Board shall within one month after the receipt of the audit report, submit an annual report to the Minister covering the activities and the operations of the Agency for the year to which the report relates.
texts.text: 20. (1) The Board shall within one month after the receipt of the audit report, submit an annual report to the Minister covering the activities and the operations of the Agency for the year to which the report relates.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2)  The annual report shall include the report of the Auditor-General.
texts.text: (2)  The annual report shall include the report of the Auditor-General.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3)  The Minister shall, within one month after the receipt of the annual report, submit the report to Parliament with a statement that the Minister considers necessary.
texts.text: (3)  The Minister shall, within one month after the receipt of the annual report, submit the report to Parliament with a statement that the Minister considers necessary.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (4) The Board shall also submit to the Minister any other reports, which the Minister may require in writing.
texts.text: (4) The Board shall also submit to the Minister any other reports, which the Minister may require in writing.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: General Guiding Principles
texts.text: General Guiding Principles

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Integrity of democratic processes and the rule of law
texts.text: Integrity of democratic processes and the rule of law

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 21. Emerging  technology  systems  shall  not  be  used  to  undermine  the  integrity, independence and effectiveness of elections and governance, democratic institutions and processes.
texts.text: 21. Emerging  technology  systems  shall  not  be  used  to  undermine  the  integrity, independence and effectiveness of elections and governance, democratic institutions and processes.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Discrimination and bias
texts.text: Discrimination and bias

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 22. Emerging technology systems, shall not be used to perpetuate algorithmic biases, discriminations, and human biases, regardless of one's background or characteristics.
texts.text: 22. Emerging technology systems, shall not be used to perpetuate algorithmic biases, discriminations, and human biases, regardless of one's background or characteristics.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Transparency and oversight
texts.text: Transparency and oversight

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 23. Emerging  technology  systems  shall  ensure  adequate  transparency  and  oversight requirements  tailored  to  the  specific  contexts  and  that  risks  are  in  place  in  respect  of activities within the lifecycle of emerging technology systems, including with regard to the identification of content generated by emerging technology systems.
texts.text: 23. Emerging  technology  systems  shall  ensure  adequate  transparency  and  oversight requirements  tailored  to  the  specific  contexts  and  that  risks  are  in  place  in  respect  of activities within the lifecycle of emerging technology systems, including with regard to the identification of content generated by emerging technology systems.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Personal data protection
texts.text: Personal data protection

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 24. Emerging  technology  systems  that  process  personal  data  shall  comply  with  the obligations under the Data Protection Act.
texts.text: 24. Emerging  technology  systems  that  process  personal  data  shall  comply  with  the obligations under the Data Protection Act.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Consumer protection
texts.text: Consumer protection

texts.label: page_header
texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 25. Any person supplying a product or service involving emerging technology shall give consumers  clear  and  unambiguous  warnings,  labelling  and  opportunities  to  give  or withhold informed consent.
texts.text: 25. Any person supplying a product or service involving emerging technology shall give consumers  clear  and  unambiguous  warnings,  labelling  and  opportunities  to  give  or withhold informed consent.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Accountability and responsibility
texts.text: Accountability and responsibility

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 26. Emerging technology system should provide accountability and responsibility for adverse impacts on human rights, democracy and the rule of law resulting from activities within the lifecycle of emerging technology systems.
texts.text: 26. Emerging technology system should provide accountability and responsibility for adverse impacts on human rights, democracy and the rule of law resulting from activities within the lifecycle of emerging technology systems.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Reliability
texts.text: Reliability

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 27. Emerging technology systems should be robust and reliable, meaning they should be able to handle unexpected inputs, errors, and malicious attacks, through rigorous testing, monitoring,  and  safeguards  to  ensure  the  safety  and  security  of  emerging  technology systems.
texts.text: 27. Emerging technology systems should be robust and reliable, meaning they should be able to handle unexpected inputs, errors, and malicious attacks, through rigorous testing, monitoring,  and  safeguards  to  ensure  the  safety  and  security  of  emerging  technology systems.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Risk and impact management
texts.text: Risk and impact management

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 28. Emerging technology systems must adopt or maintain measures for the identification, assessment, prevention and mitigation of risks  posed  by  emerging technology  systems  by  considering  actual  and  potential  impacts  to  human  rights, democracy and the rule of law.
texts.text: 28. Emerging technology systems must adopt or maintain measures for the identification, assessment, prevention and mitigation of risks  posed  by  emerging technology  systems  by  considering  actual  and  potential  impacts  to  human  rights, democracy and the rule of law.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Human oversights
texts.text: Human oversights

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 29. Human intervention, interface or review shall be necessary for emerging technology decisions  that  substantially  affect  the  rights  of  persons,  including  decisions  related  to health, law enforcement, employment and elections.
texts.text: 29. Human intervention, interface or review shall be necessary for emerging technology decisions  that  substantially  affect  the  rights  of  persons,  including  decisions  related  to health, law enforcement, employment and elections.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Misinformation and disinformation
texts.text: Misinformation and disinformation

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 30. Emerging technology systems shall not spread false information including emerging technology-generated misinformation and disinformation.
texts.text: 30. Emerging technology systems shall not spread false information including emerging technology-generated misinformation and disinformation.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Security
texts.text: Security

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 31. Emerging technology systems should provide robust security protection of its cyber system.
texts.text: 31. Emerging technology systems should provide robust security protection of its cyber system.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Environmental safeguards
texts.text: Environmental safeguards

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Enforcement
texts.text: Enforcement

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 35. (1) For the time being and until such time as the Minister may direct, the following regulatory bodies shall monitor and enforce compliance in accordance with the general guiding principles and subsection (2):
texts.text: 35. (1) For the time being and until such time as the Minister may direct, the following regulatory bodies shall monitor and enforce compliance in accordance with the general guiding principles and subsection (2):

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) the Electoral Commission of Ghana shall be responsible for section 20;
texts.text: (a) the Electoral Commission of Ghana shall be responsible for section 20;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) the  Commission  on  Human  Rights  and  Administrative  Justice  shall  be responsible for section 21, and where appropriate, the Ministry in charge of labour affairs or the National Labour Commission shall be responsible for section 21;
texts.text: (b) the  Commission  on  Human  Rights  and  Administrative  Justice  shall  be responsible for section 21, and where appropriate, the Ministry in charge of labour affairs or the National Labour Commission shall be responsible for section 21;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) the National Information Technology Agency shall be responsible for section 22;
texts.text: (c) the National Information Technology Agency shall be responsible for section 22;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) the Data Protection Authority shall be responsible for section 23;
texts.text: (d) the Data Protection Authority shall be responsible for section 23;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) the  Ghana  Standards  Authority,  Foods  and  Drugs  Authority  shall  be responsible  for  section  24,  and  depending  on  the  sector,  the  applicable regulatory body shall also be responsible for section 24;
texts.text: (e) the  Ghana  Standards  Authority,  Foods  and  Drugs  Authority  shall  be responsible  for  section  24,  and  depending  on  the  sector,  the  applicable regulatory body shall also be responsible for section 24;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) the  Commission  on  Human  Rights  and  Administrative  Justice  shall  be responsible for section 25;
texts.text: (f) the  Commission  on  Human  Rights  and  Administrative  Justice  shall  be responsible for section 25;

texts.orig: (g) the National Information Technology Agency shall be responsible for section 26;
texts.text: (g) the National Information Technology Agency shall be responsible for section 26;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) the Cybersecurity Authority shall be responsible for section 27;
texts.text: (h) the Cybersecurity Authority shall be responsible for section 27;

texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 32. Developers of emerging technology systems, particularly those requiring extensive energy  consumption  and  likelihood  of  increased  carbon-dioxide  emissions,  leading  to massive introduction of electronic waste should ensure environmental safeguards.
texts.text: Developers of emerging technology systems, particularly those requiring extensive energy  consumption  and  likelihood  of  increased  carbon-dioxide  emissions,  leading  to massive introduction of electronic waste should ensure environmental safeguards.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Intellectual Property
texts.text: Intellectual Property

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 33. Developers of emerging technology and emerging technology systems should be entitled to intellectual property rights in accordance with the existing laws.
texts.text: Developers of emerging technology and emerging technology systems should be entitled to intellectual property rights in accordance with the existing laws.

texts.orig: Right to Redress
texts.text: Right to Redress

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 34. Notwithstanding section 35(2), a person shall have a right of redress for breach of any provision of this Act in Court.
texts.text: Notwithstanding section 35(2), a person shall have a right of redress for breach of any provision of this Act in Court.

texts.text: (i) depending on the sector, the applicable ministry or regulatory body shall also be responsible for section 28;

texts.orig: (2) Without prejudice to other penalties under any other enactment or law, a person who  breaches  any  of  the  guiding  principles  under  this  Act  shall  be  liable  to  an administrative penalty of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units, depending on the severity of the infraction.
texts.text: (2) Without prejudice to other penalties under any other enactment or law, a person who  breaches  any  of  the  guiding  principles  under  this  Act  shall  be  liable  to  an administrative penalty of not less than one thousand penalty units and not more than five thousand penalty units, depending on the severity of the infraction.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Interpretation
texts.text: Interpretation

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 37. In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,
texts.text: 37. In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires,

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'algorithm' means a set of instructions designed to accomplish a task;
texts.text: 'algorithm' means a set of instructions designed to accomplish a task;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'artificial intelligence' means technology that enables computers and machines to simulate human learning, comprehension, problem solving, decision-making, creativity and autonomy;
texts.text: 'artificial intelligence' means technology that enables computers and machines to simulate human learning, comprehension, problem solving, decision-making, creativity and autonomy;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'block -chain based technology' means an advanced decentralised digital record or digital ledger of transactions, that enables recording of transactions, tracking of assets, and sharing of records across computer networks in a transparent and immutable way;
texts.text: 'block -chain based technology' means an advanced decentralised digital record or digital ledger of transactions, that enables recording of transactions, tracking of assets, and sharing of records across computer networks in a transparent and immutable way;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Court' means High Court of Ghana;
texts.text: 'Court' means High Court of Ghana;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'cloud  technology'  means  technology  that  delivers  computing  services  and  offers  on -demand  access  to  computing  resources  such  as  physical  or  virtual  services,  data
texts.text: 'cloud  technology'  means  technology  that  delivers  computing  services  and  offers  on -demand  access  to  computing  resources  such  as  physical  or  virtual  services,  data

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025
texts.text: EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES BILL, 2025

texts.label: text
texts.orig: storage, servers, databases, networking, intelligence, analytics, and software over the internet;'
texts.text: storage, servers, databases, networking, intelligence, analytics, and software over the internet;'

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'emerging  technology'  means  novel  or  evolving  systems,  tools  or  methods  that  have transformative impacts ndustry, society, economy, and governance, and include but is not limited to:
texts.text: 'emerging  technology'  means  novel  or  evolving  systems,  tools  or  methods  that  have transformative impacts ndustry, society, economy, and governance, and include but is not limited to:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Artificial Intelligence
texts.text: (a) Artificial Intelligence

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Blockchain-based technology
texts.text: (b) Blockchain-based technology

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) Internet of Things (IoT)
texts.text: (c) Internet of Things (IoT)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) Cloud technology
texts.text: (d) Cloud technology

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) Quantum computing
texts.text: (e) Quantum computing

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'emerging technology systems' means newly developed or evolving technological systems of emerging technology that integrate automation, data processing, connectivity, and intelligence.
texts.text: 'emerging technology systems' means newly developed or evolving technological systems of emerging technology that integrate automation, data processing, connectivity, and intelligence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'Internet  of  Things  (IoT)'  means  a  network  of  interrelated  physical  devices,  vehicles, appliances  and  other  physical  objects  that  connect  and  exchange  data  with  other devices  and  the  cloud  across  wireless  networks,  and  are  typically  embedded  with sensors,  processing  ability  and  software  and  can  include  mechanical  and  digital machines and consumer objects;'
texts.text: 'Internet  of  Things  (IoT)'  means  a  network  of  interrelated  physical  devices,  vehicles, appliances  and  other  physical  objects  that  connect  and  exchange  data  with  other devices  and  the  cloud  across  wireless  networks,  and  are  typically  embedded  with sensors,  processing  ability  and  software  and  can  include  mechanical  and  digital machines and consumer objects;'

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Minister'  means  Minister  responsible  for  Communication,  Digital  Technology  and Innovations;
texts.text: 'Minister'  means  Minister  responsible  for  Communication,  Digital  Technology  and Innovations;

texts.orig: 'Ministry' means Ministry of Communication, Digital Technology and Innovations;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 'quantum  computing'  means  technology  that  solves  complex  problems  based  on principles of quantum mechanics.
texts.text: 'quantum  computing'  means  technology  that  solves  complex  problems  based  on principles of quantum mechanics.
